document.title: Maryland World-Readiness Standards for Learning Languages

3CE44F2EE6F142BC89073DD6D03D9FF2.description:
Listen to music, sing songs, or play musical instruments from the target
culture.

7660D78DDAF846A9AE529340EA04F17B.description: Attend or use media to view cultural events and social activities.

6AC1B00774664D1DBE1C6B14B05B98D4.description: Use various media from the target language and culture for entertainment.

F773B81472C140D58902124A98584D8D.description: Exchange information about topics of personal interest.

D517BDF15E8D483D85E968AF74138B67.description: Play sports or games from the target culture.

38F6EEBB332349F4B1AFC17365458031.description:
Consult various sources in the target language to obtain information on
topics of personal interest.

5A4EAF66576E484CA7AC084E08C72C32.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the can-do statements
for each unit.

1D23A9BC838F42218A6E330B3D20FB39.description:
Create can-do statements with the help of their teachers of what they
want to communicate in the target language for each unit of instruction.

7CF3C9B2E1DB4E51B7AD24D252648189.description:
Collect evidence showing that they have achieved the can-do statements
for each unit.

FA01208BFB564164832CF367940CC6D3.description:
Create can-do statements with the help of their teachers of what they
want to communicate in the target language for each unit of instruction.

FFDC0DDFE78B46D2B7221496814E9790.description:
Listen to music, sing songs, or play musical instruments from the target
culture.

E455B2BE2770435882BA9C8AE717CB72.description: Attend or use media to view cultural events and social activities.

9018AB9B49AE44EBAAFF87A68BCD72E8.description: Exchange information about topics of personal interest.

9E98E2DB5BD24D5B8329C6BE4E2D8262.description: Play sports or games from the target culture.

BED9B86DEEA6425CA13CE7B29672B5D3.description:
Interpret material and/or use media from the target language and culture
for enjoyment.

0A30F70B505C4035A094ED0327810B59.description: LIFELONG LEARNING: Learners set goals and reflect on their progress in using language for enjoyment, enrichment, and advancement.

3512C2BC9A45497899541CB58F435808.description:
Participate in language club activities that benefit the school or
community.

227C01AD40F14A1EBAD9983E4B3DEFAC.description:
Interact with members of the local community or with contacts made
electronically to hear how they use the language in their various fields of
work.

9DDF50B7AB264A90B69A52EF249295CD.description: Perform for school, campus, or community celebrations.

89DC1CE6DB0546EA857DE8897BB5F684.description: Write and illustrate short stories to present to others.

0D3AD172896E45A59CB7DA83276F277B.description: Conduct online research and report on a cultural event or a school topic.

CDABFA5A1F2F478AB52AE583F05F8D88.description: Identify professions that require proficiency in another language.

B7CCAF3465B748FBAE7712B3A9DE1ADA.description:
Access relationships with speakers of the language either in person or via
texting, email, social media forums, or voice chats.

AC25871F31F7468FBAE538E32BA2A755.description:
Identify places that another language is used and attempt to interact with
the language in some way (e.g., finding products in the language at a
grocery store, attempting to speak to a community member in a library or
restaurant).

2C3CDF5FF5084EDB83539E1644C4400A.description: SCHOOL AND GLOBAL COMMUNITIES: Learners use the language both within and beyond the classroom to interact and collaborate in their community and the globalized world.

BD0C94D38A4940ED8FB88483CE141499.description: COMMUNITIES: Learners communicate and interact with cultural competence in order to participate in multilingual communities at home and around the world.

1567FC9EF07B44E1945AD1F897A73F4E.description:
Hypothesize about the relationship between cultural perspectives and
practices (e.g., holidays, celebrations, work habits, play) by analyzing
selected practices from the target culture and their own.

7BA77D7834254B8594C7EE91263C74BE.description:
Speculate on why certain products originate in and/or are important to
particular cultures by analyzing selected products from the target culture
and their own.

09F704A37BE542A1BA936910BFBCA2C9.description:
Fill in a graphic organizer that compares sample daily activities in the
target culture and their own.

F20CF559F39D4C728AF7E327A8B51C1B.description:
Compare and contrast intangible products (e.g., rhymes, songs, folktales)
of the target cultures and their own.

3758F45DC6C348F8AE0EFC6884FA19AE.description:
Compare simple patterns of behavior or interaction in various cultural
settings (e.g., transportation to school, eating habits).

0F9F504FF89B46FE956B68635317110C.description:
Compare and contrast tangible products (e.g., toys, sports, equipment,
foods) of the target culture and their own.

1F103084B6BD48C28822A0489DE64DFA.description:
Appropriately use gestures used to greet friends, family, or new
acquaintances.

CA6967E247274EC287EB45AC44170EBE.description: CULTURAL COMPARISONS: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the concept of culture through comparisons of the cultures studied and their own.

A1F055E10F19450AA5907A29F7FBEAAC.description: Notice how different time frames are expressed in the target language.

C9AE9619059F41AE823518AB38FEAAD3.description: Compare word order in the target language to English.

50491800421A4867AC66B2EA2B1C54B9.description:
Identify words in the target language that have no translation in English
and vice versa.

900FFF90F5B4484D8D9EEC712E3C7C96.description:
Match groups of people with ways of expressing respect and
communicating status differences in their own language and the language
they are learning.

DBB8C7ABD7524B40827E03DD0D187120.description:
Report differences and similarities between the sound and writing
systems of their own language and the language being learned.

ADF5DC32E6A74C4894D9A390DF9A4A78.description:
Observe and identify formal and informal forms of language in greetings
and leave-takings.

ACAA9369254148B7917A1C0A3A473E78.description:
Inventory idiomatic expressions in both their native language and the
language being learned and talk about how idiomatic expressions work in
general.

57CEDC7F366849548C7FE91553698442.description:
Identify cognates between the target language and their native language
and cite the patterns that connect them, and they detect false cognates
when the context in which they see them suggests a misfit.

13AFD1968C6342E389830DE2CAA00864.description:
Cite and use examples of words that are similar in the language they are
learning and their native language and they pose guesses about why
languages in general might need to borrow words.

91F53C8180BB4734A89349F64342B46E.description: LANGUAGE COMPARISONS: Learners use the language to investigate, explain and reflect on the nature of language through comparisons of the language studied and their own.

5645529B4A934347B5963668ACB795AD.description: COMPARISONS: Learners develop insight into the nature of language and culture in order to interact with cultural competence.

873AC0CEBB934D73AD0CA737D5D67D41.description:
Use sources intended for same-age speakers of the target language to
prepare presentations on familiar topics.

23308E2C18244731B0355DFA3C469127.description:
Expand vocabulary for working with school content through illustrated
visuals (e.g., plants, anatomy, timelines of historical periods, maps).

8664F7F1898644DD9ACA159A85355B49.description:
Read, listen to, or talk about age-appropriate school content such as
ecology, social studies, sciences, the arts, physical education, and health.

4056C9D9FA10474FBC79BD992499A4C5.description: ACQUIRING INFORMATION AND DIVERSE PERSPECTIVES: Learners access and evaluate information and diverse perspectives that are available through the language and its cultures.

1DDFC2A70EAA47A385376E2B1844744F.description:
Use their knowledge of geography to create maps of countries where the
target language is spoken.

3E1626BEFFDB413F88E773A37C245497.description:
Write original poems, stories, and plays using their understanding of the
characteristics of these genres gained in English language arts.

42577903A327480EACD6FEF410D87CF2.description:
Use their knowledge of history to create timelines of historic events in the
countries where the target language is spoken.

6C9491AF2B6C40998A0E4478BA5C18DA.description:
Share information in the target language about topics from other school
subjects, including geographical terms and concepts, historical facts and
concepts, mathematical terms and problems, and scientific information.

3A4B6C364AA449538354B8F7B7252302.description:
Read or listen to stories from the target culture and compare them to
familiar stories from the same genre (e.g., folklore, fables, myths,
legends).

844167F2716E408B8FD3811FA1CED81A.description:
Use a website about the rainforest that was introduced in a science class
to create a product in the target language that highlights plants, animal
life, and weather in the area.

53ED8BF6507742528A507C0D304FA56E.description:
Draw and mark maps of their cities, states, and of countries where the
target language is used with civic and geographic features studied in
other classes.

A29BD5700D3E4EC084B97BC20A3EDE05.description:
Identify and label items in the target language on charts and visuals used
as instructional materials in other content areas, including weather, math
facts, measurements, animals, musical instruments, or geographical
formations.

C95C4C81D2494AADBCD513705F7AD81A.description: MAKING CONNECTIONS: Learners build, reinforce, and expand their knowledge of other disciplines while using the language to develop critical thinking and to solve problems creatively.

12CA56E13E6049DB943F5D2EB3FBE42B.description: CONNECTIONS: Learners connect with other disciplines and acquire information and diverse perspectives in order to use the language to function in academic and career-related situations.

9E02C858A80646EAA2983D31F455EC07.description:
Search for, identify, and investigate the function of products (e.g., sports
equipment, household items, tools, foods, clothing) of the target culture
studied compared to their function within the learners’ homes and
communities.

A3538C8B8BF44562841454E5AFFC533B.description:
Experience (read, listen to, observe, perform) expressive products of the
target culture (e.g., stories, poetry, music, paintings, dance, drama) and
explain the origin and importance of these products in today’s culture.

E5BDEEB2FB9741719ABA85B6CF05B476.description:
Make simple cultural triangles showing the relationship of products,
practices, and perspectives.

94E912BA95834A208B9619B1C60BB037.description: Illustrate products associated with the target culture.

047EE83EDD8947719B3363CFBEB68C0B.description:
Listen to or read about expressive products of the target culture such as
children’s or traditional songs, selections from the literature commonly
read, and types of artwork enjoyed or produced by their peer group in the
target culture.

C955F8EF6674442D92088ACE3B995470.description: Identify and tell the purpose of products of the target culture.

C11B4BF2DC614553BA6D355AB7654C40.description:
Identify, discuss, and produce types of artwork, crafts, or graphic
representations enjoyed or made by their peer group within the target
culture such as models of monuments, mosaics, murals, and traditional
recipes.

59E74ED761F64A3BA829F13A4BECB96A.description:
Identify and observe tangible products of the target culture such as toys,
dress, homes, monuments, currency, famous people, and art.

E484768334AB45F8A615EEA13B86195D.description:
RELATING CULTURAL PRODUCTS TO PERSPECTIVES: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the products and perspectives of the cultures
studied.

54C914B16FFD48A28896DBDF34CB91C7.description:
Create cultural triangles connecting practices to associated products and
perspectives, beginning to analyze the relationship among the practices,
products, and perspectives.

B813D6CBFAB34526A5E67EFA87A327E6.description:
Use some culturally appropriate gestures and expressions in their
interactions with others.

72E57BDD13FA4636B3290863A6A99BC3.description:
Role play simple situations from the target culture such as buying a snack
using culturally appropriate gestures and language.

ABF2885042AE4A2493BE5D2304C7037F.description: Distinguish informal and formal ways to address classmates and adults.

491E55BA6779423C9460A3170B24E1F2.description:
Participate in age-appropriate cultural practices such as games (e.g., role
of leader, taking turns), sports, and entertainment (e.g., music, dance,
drama).

59718895823C4980B2D392FA2B43CF51.description:
Observe, analyze, and exchange information on patterns of behavior
typical of their peer group in the culture, such as observing and analyzing
how different ways of greeting and leave-taking reflect the relationships
between people in the target culture.

1927431777A4467CB7C5AA536B9DD7F3.description:
List practices observed in a video of a festival or holiday celebrated in the
target culture.

BB14A457082444CBA5524BC941D01748.description:
Use words and phrases to describe what people from the target culture
are doing in photos and short videos and ask simple questions about
characteristics of daily life after looking at the photos or short videos.

B2EDF784DC624EA7A776F10F708385B6.description: Observe and imitate simple patterns of behavior at school.

796912207A2545F1A44E46FF1D220D15.description:
Create or propose simple cultural triangles connecting practices to
associated products and perspectives.

E111542945ED43808BBACF42DCF6A69A.description:
Participate in or simulate age-appropriate cultural activities such as
games, birthday celebrations, storytelling, and dramatizations.

B9227131ACA24B0496DCA3A21ACA56DE.description:
Use appropriate gestures and oral expressions for greetings, leave
takings, and common classroom or social interactions.

16022957533147B385A3C42C46144E3F.description: RELATING CULTURAL PRACTICES TO PERSPECTIVES: Learners use the language to investigate, explain, and reflect on the relationship between the practices and perspectives of the cultures studied.

A354D5AD1B6A4816AA0CC5AA1682EA0D.description: CULTURES: Learners interact with cultural competence and understanding.
